Kepala Dinas Pariwisata DKI Minta Distafkan Anies Baswedan
02 Nov 2019, 00:45 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


( Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan. CNN Indonesia/ Adhi Wicaksono)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Badan Kepegawaian Daerah (BKD) DKI Jakarta sudah menerima surat pengunduran diri Edy Juanedi. Edy merupakan Kepala Dinas Pariwisata dan Kebudayaan DKI Jakarta.Kepala BKD Chaidir mengatakan bahwa Edy meminta sendiri untuk mengundurkan diri. Edy sendiri yang meminta untuk diturunkan jabatannya."Dia hanya menyatakan mengundurkan diri dari jabatannya dan minta menjadi staf di Anjungan Dinas Pariwisata," kata Chaidir saat dihubungi, Jumat (1/11).Surat pengunduran diri Edy, kata Chaidir, diterima per tanggal 31 Oktober 2019. Surat tersebut ditujukan kepada Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan dan diterima oleh Sekretaris Daerah DKI Saefullah."Benar tanggal 31 disampaikan kepada Gubernur melalui pak Sekda," ujar dia.Chaidir menyatakan Edy tak menyertakan alasan apapun terkait pengunduran dirinya. Chaidir juga membantah turunnya Edy karena permasalahan dana influencer sebesar Rp5 miliar."Enggak, enggak mungkin soal influencer," tegas Chaidir.Ke depannya posisi Kepala Dinas Pariwisata akan diisi oleh pelaksana tugas. Chaidir mengatakan posisi Plt akan diseleksi setelah mendapat arahan dari Anies."Seleksi diisi dulu oleh Plt. Kita mengikut arahan pimpinan saja," tutup dia.Sebelumnya Dinas Pariwisata tersandung kasus dana promosi influencer sebesar Rp5 miliar. Anggaran itu diketahui untuk membiayai kegiatan promosi pariwisata ibu kota melalui media sosial.Berdasarkan usulan pada Kebijakan Umum APBD Plafon Prioritas Anggaran Sementara (KUAPPAS) DKI 2020, dana itu akan digunakan untuk membiayai aktivitas pariwisata yang oleh influencer di media sosial.Dana sebesar Rp5.008.691.930 itu disasarkan pada lima influencer. Influencer secara umum adalah orang yang memiliki pengikut relatif besar di media sosial sehingga dijadikan model panutan.Belakangan, Asiantoro mengatakan anggaran tersebut telah dicoret karena efisensi anggaran yang dilakukan oleh DKI Jakarta. CNNIndonesia.com sudah mencoba menghubungi Edy namun belum mendapatkan konfirmasi.(ctr/agt)

Head of DKI Tourism Office Requests to Distribute Anies Baswedan
02 Nov 2019, 00:45 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


(DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan. CNN Indonesia / Adhi Wicaksono)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - DKI Jakarta Regional Personnel Agency (BKD) has received Edy Juanedi's resignation letter. Edy is the Head of the DKI Jakarta Tourism and Culture Office. Head of BKD Chaidir said that Edy asked himself to resign. Edy himself asked to be demoted. "He only said that he resigned from his position and asked to become a staff at the Pavilion of the Tourism Office," Chaidir said when contacted on Friday (1/11). Edy's resignation letter, said Chaidir, was accepted as of 31 October 2019. The letter was addressed to DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan and received by DKI Regional Secretary Saefullah. "It was true that on the 31st it was delivered to the Governor through the Secretary," he said. Chaidir stated Edy did not include any reasons related to his resignation. Chaidir also denied Edy's decline because of the Rp5 billion influencer fund problem. "No, it's not possible about the influencers," Chaidir stressed. Chaidir said that the Acting position would be selected after receiving directions from Anies. "The selection was filled first by Acting. We will follow the direction of the leadership," he concluded. The budget is known to finance the capital's tourism promotion activities through social media. Based on the proposal on the 2020 2020 Provisional Budget Ceiling (KUAPPAS) APBD, the funds will be used to fund tourism activities carried out by influencers on social media. Funds of Rp5,008,691 .930 was targeted at five influencers. Influencers in general are people who have a relatively large following on social media so they are made a role model. Later, Asiantoro said the budget had been crossed out because of the budget efficiency carried out by DKI Jakarta. CNNIndonesia.com has tried to contact Edy but has not yet received confirmation. (Ctr / Aug)
